The range of variant a is mostly northeastern, where it is known from elevations to 1700 m in Newfoundland, west to Manitoba and south to North Carolina.
It has culms only 0.5-1.2 mm wide;
and spikelets with proximal scale often clasping 0.8 of the culm.

Plants from the more southern part of the range are especially striking because of their extremely oblique, brightly red-margined sheath summits and proximal floral scales usually clasping to 0.8 of the culm.
It is similar to unusually robust forms of variant a, from which it differs in that its achenes are 1.6-2 mm, culm stomates 52-65 um, and floral scales mostly 3.5-4.5 mm.
Variant ca. apparently grows mostly as an emergent in open water to about 1 m deep.
Most of these plants closely resemble most specimens that I have seen from northern Eurasia and as described for Eleocharis palustris subsp. palustris by S. -O. Strandhede (1966).
Some plants of variant d that have markedly narrow tubercles mostly much (to 2 times) higher than wide and narrow achenes only 0.9-1.1 mm wide may deserve taxonomic recognition;
Specimens of variant d from scattered western localities from Alaska and Yukon south to California have floral scales 4-5 mm and achenes 1.6-1.9 mm and are very similar to variant c.

lemma ca. 3 mm, ovate, entire, obtuse, scabrid, narrowly hyaline at margins and tip, 9-nerved.
Anthers 1 mm.
Culms stout, erect, 80-200 cm tall, up to 10 mm in diameter.
leaf blades flat, light green, 25-50 cm x 8-16 mm, with transverse veinlets, abaxial surface scabrid, adaxial surface smooth or sparsely scabrid, apex acute;
ligule 2-4 mm.
Panicle ovate to oblong in outline, usually laxly contracted, 20-40 cm, exserted, spikelets many;
branches 4-10 per node, obliquely ascending, relatively thick, scabrid.
Spikelets narrowly oblong, 5-12 mm, florets 5-10, yellowish green or purple tinged;
Stamens 3, anthers 1.2-1.8 mm.
A perennial 30-90 cm, smelling of spearmint.

Leaves 4-9 x 1.3-3 cm, lanceolate, or oblong-lanceolate to broadly ovate, acute or acuminate, sharply serrate, green and glabrous on both on both faces or with a few hairs below, sessile or subsessile (petiole not more than 3 mm) not or only slightly rugose.
Inflorescence a terminal cylindrical spike 3-6 cm, whorls often becoming +- separate.
Calyx campanulate with narrow triangular to subulate teeth, 1-3 mm.
Stamens 4, normally exserted, diverging, +- equal in length;
A weak pubescent or glabrescent perennial 15-50 cm.
Leaves 2-5 cm, ovate-lanceolate or oblong-lanceolate, obtuse or subacute, cordate or rounded, remotely and shallowly crenate;
Calyx campanulate, with sparse eglandular hairs, 2-lipped, closed after flowering, lips entire, the upper bearing a small scale on the back.
Corolla 10-18(-20) mm, several times as long as calyx, 2 lipped, the upper lip helmet shaped, the lateral lobes small, +- free from the lips, tube somewhat curved below, blue violet.
Stamens 4, outer pair longer than inner.
Stems erect, 35-40 cm tall, slightly grooved, glabrous except for sparsely retrorse pubescent angles, leafless basally, much branched upward.
Petiole 2-7 mm;
leaf blade oblong-lanceolate, 1.5-6 x 0.8-3 cm, larger basally, membranous to papery, pubescent, base shallowly cordate, margin crenate-serrate, apex acute.
pedicel ca. 2 mm, densely retrorse pubescent.
Calyx ca. 3.5 mm, densely white pubescent outside, to 5 mm in fruit;
scutellum ca. 0.8 mm, erect, to 1.5 mm in fruit.
Corolla purple to blue, ca. 1.8 cm, glandular pubescent outside, lips partly puberulent;
tube base slightly saccate, throat 3.5-5 mm wide;
upper lip semicircular, ca. 2.5 mm wide;
lateral lobes oblong, ca. 1.5 mm wide.
Nutlets yellow, triquetrous, ovoid, ca. 1 mm in diameter. , tuberculate, adaxially umbonate at middle.
Stems 20-60 cm, ascending or erect, acutely quadrangular, leafy, simple or branched with very short crisped retrorse eglandular white hairs.

Leaves oblong-lanceolate, 7-45 x 3-15 mm, decreasing in size up the stem, weakly crenulate, sometimes revolute, cordate-truncate, acute, with a very short eglandular indumentum denser below, upper surface sometimes glabrous;
lower leaves with a petiole up to 2 cm, upper sessile.
Pedicels 1-1.5 mm, erect-spreading, with very small basal scales, terete.
Calyx 3-3.5 mm in flower, enlarging in fruit to 4.5 mm and with a 2 mm high scutellum, with a similar indumentum but denser to that of stem.
Corolla blue to violet-blue with some white markings, 12-16 mm, densely pilose;
tube 8-10 mm;
Nutlets prominently tuberculate, orange-brown, c. 1.5 x 1 mm.
Culms hollow, +- spongy near base, trigonous in cross section, 35-125 cm;
ligules (6-)11-45 mm;
blades 3-10 mm wide, usually sparsely to moderately long-pubescent, finely papillose abaxially, glabrous adaxially.
Inflorescences 12-60 cm;
proximal 2-5 spikes pistillate;
terminal (1-)2-6 spikes staminate.
beak 2.1-4 mm, glabrous (rarely few spreading hairs on main veins), teeth spreading to outcurved, (1.2-)1.5-3 mm.
A erect, glabrous, rather glaucous perennial, 30-80(-120) cm.
Rhizome often 3-5 cm diameter.
Leaves evergreen, 15-25 mm wide, ensiform, +- equalling the scape.
Spathes herbaceous, 2-3 flowered, little branched.
Flowers 8-10 cm diameter, yellow, varying from pale to almost orange.
Rhizomes pink, freely branching, producing extensive clumps, 2-3 cm diameter. , with fibrous remains of old leaves;
Leaves: basal deciduous, at first erect, then recurved, blade dark green, with prominent median thickening, 4-10 dm x 2-3 cm, slightly glaucous basally;
spathes green with brown margins, outer spathe strongly keeled, inner without keel, 6-9 cm, subequal, margins not scarious.

petals without veining, lanceolate to spatulate, 2-3 cm;
ovary triangular in cross section with concave sides and narrow groove at each angle, 1.5 cm;
style keeled, 3-4 cm, crests spreading, 1-1.2 cm, laciniate at apex;

Capsules prismatic to oblong-ovoid, obscurely 3-angled with obvious groove at each angle, 3.5-6 cm, beak 5 mm.
Erect perennial to 1.5 m glabrous or +- pubescent, simple or with a few short slender branches.
Inflorescence to 30 cm or more, spike like, usually dense and many flowered.
Flowers 10-15 mm, arranged in whorls in the axils of bracts.
Calyx pubescent, tube c. 6 mm, cylindrical, ribbed, teeth 2-3 mm.
Petals 8-10 mm, obovate, purple.
Fruit a capsule 2-4 mm, oblong-ovoid, enclosed in the calyx.
blade lanceolate, 2-10(-14) x 0.5-2 mm, base cordate or rounded.
floral tube cylindrical, 4-6 x 2 mm;
epicalyx segments equal to or to 2 times length of sepals;
petals rose purple, oblong to obovate, 6-14 x 2.5-4 mm;
stamens 12, of 2 lengths.
Perennial herbs or subshrubs, 0.3-1.5 m tall, scabrous or sparsely to densely gray pubescent [or tomentose], sometimes somewhat glabrescent.
Stem erect, 4-angled.
Leaves opposite or 3-whorled, sometimes alternate toward stem apex, ovate-lanceolate to broadly lanceolate, 2.5-10 x 0.5-1.5 cm, base rounded, truncate, or semiclasping, apex acute to subobtuse.
Inflorescences terminal, spicate, 15-35 cm;
Flowers in 1- to multi-flowered whorled axillary cymes, shortly pedicellate.
Floral tube 5-8 x 1.5-2 mm, 12-ribbed;
sepals deltate, 0.5-1 mm;
epicalyx segments erect, linear, 1.5-2 mm, much longer than sepals.
Petals reddish purple to rose-purple, lanceolate-oblanceolate, 7-10 x 1.5-3 mm.
Perennial, 40-70 cm tall.
Leaves ovate-lanceolate, elliptic or lanceolate, acute to acuminate, base cordate-amplexicaul, 6-60 mm long, 2.5-15 mm broad.
Spikes 9-45 cm long.

Petals 5.5-8.5 mm long, 2-3 mm broad, obovate-spathulate or obovate-oblanceolate.
Ovary subsessile, 2-5 mm long, 0.75-1.5 mm broad.
Capsule 4 mm long, 1.5 mm broad, narrowed.

Rhizomes creeping at or near surface, elongate, 1-3 cm diameter.
Leaves: petiole 6-30(-40) cm;
blade 4-14 cm wide;
Inflorescences: spathe ovate to elliptic, 3-6(-8) cm, apex long-apiculate, 4-10 mm;
stamens (6-)9-12, of 2 types, outer with broad filaments and inner with narrow filaments;
ovaries 1-locular;
ovules 6-9, anatropous.
Infructescences 2-5 ' 1.5-3.5 cm.
Fruits pear-shaped, 6-12 ' 5-10 mm.
Rhizome creeping, green, cylindric, to 50 cm, robust, 1-2(-3) cm in diameter. , somewhat spongy;

sheath 7-8(-12) cm, with free ligule;

Peduncle green, terete, 15-30 x 0.8-1.2 cm.

An rather stout annual herb with erect, glabrous or sparsely hairy stems, 8-60(-75) cm simple or branched above.
Leaves 4-15 cm, simple, lanceolate-acuminate, sessile, the members of an opposite pair slightly connate, coarsely serrate, glabrous or slightly hairy, pale green.

Outer bracts 5-8 mm, lanceolate, leaf-like, much longer than the inner, spreading;
Ray-florets usually 0;
receptacular scales ca. 8 mm, oblanceolate, scarious.
Annuals, (2-)20-100(-400+) cm (stems sometimes rooting at proximal nodes).
Leaves (rarely in 3 s) sessile;

blades lance-ovate or oblanceolate to lanceolate or linear, 40-100(-200+) x (2-)5-25(-45+) mm, bases cuneate to rounded, margins usually coarsely dentate to serrate, sometimes entire, sometimes ciliate, apices acute to acuminate, faces glabrous.
Peduncles 10-40(-100+) mm.

Calyculi of (3-)5-8(-10) spreading to reflexed, oblong to lance-linear, often +- foliaceous bractlets or bracts (3-)8-12(-25+) mm, margins usually ciliate, abaxial faces usually glabrous, bases sometimes hispidulous.
Involucres +- hemispheric or broader, (3-)6-10 x (8-)12-20+ mm.

blade ovate-lanceolate or oblanceolate to lanceolate or linear, 40-100(-200) x (2-)5-25(-45) mm, both surfaces glabrous, base cuneate to rounded, margin usually coarsely dentate to serrate, sometimes entire, sometimes ciliate, apex acute to acuminate.
peduncles 10-40(-100+) mm;

calycular bracts (3-)5-8(-10), spreading to reflexed, oblong to linear-lanceolate, often +- leaflike, (3-)8-12(-25) mm, abaxially usually glabrous, bases sometimes hispidulous, margin usually ciliate;

Ray florets usually 6-8, sometimes absent;

pappus of (2-)4 retrorsely barbed awns (1-)2-4 mm.
An annual herb with erect, usually much branched glabrous or somewhat downy stem 15-60(-75) cm.
Leaves 5-15 cm, usually 3(-5) -partite, sometimes simple, narrowed below into a short-winged petiole, rarely all unlobed (var. integra Koch);

Leaves sessile or petioles 5-15(-35+) mm (+- winged);
Heads borne singly or in 2 s or 3 s. Peduncles 10-40(-80) mm.

Annuals, 10-150 cm tall.
petiole (0-)5-15(-35) mm (+- winged);
peduncles 10-40(-80) mm;

calycular bracts (2-)6 or 7(-10), spreading, oblanceolate or lanceolate to linear, +- leaflike, 7-35(-60) mm, abaxially hispidulous near bases, distally glabrous, margins entire or serrate, sometimes sparsely ciliate;
involucres campanulate to hemispheric or broader, (4-)5-7(-12) x (3-)6-12(-15) mm;
Ray florets usually 0, sometimes 1-5;
lamina orange yellowish, 4-8 mm.
Disk florets (5-)20-60(-150);
corollas pale yellow to orange, (2-)3-4 mm, apex 4- or 5-toothed.
Basal leaves: petiole (0.5-)2-10(-17) cm;

blade lyrate-pinnatifid, (1-)2-8(-10) cm, lobes 1-3(-5) on each side (rarely early ones undivided), lateral lobes oblong or ovate, 0.3-2(-4) cm x 1-8(-15) mm, sometimes slightly fleshy, margins entire, repand, crenate, or dentate, terminal lobe (ovate or suborbicular), (0.7-)1.5-4.5(-7) cm x (4-)10-30(-50) mm, (surfaces glabrous or margins ciliate).

Flowers: sepals 3-4.5(-5) x 1-1.5 mm, lateral pair slightly saccate basally, margins scarious;

filaments 3-4.5 mm;

ovules 18-24(-28) per ovary;
gynophore to 0.5 mm.
Fruits erect to erect-ascending, rarely appressed to rachis, torulose, terete, somewhat compressed, or 4-angled, (0.7-)1.5-3 cm x 1.2-2 mm;
style slender, (1-)1.5-3(-3.5) mm.
Stems (20-)30-80(-100) cm tall, erect, angled, branched above.

auricles ovate or narrowly oblong, to 10 x 5 mm, often ciliate.

anthers oblong, 0.7-1.2 mm.
Fruiting pedicels divaricate or erect-ascending, 3-7 mm, terete or subquadrangular, glabrous, narrower than fruit.
Fruit linear, (0.7-)1.5-3 cm x 1-1.5 mm, terete, somewhat compressed, or 4-angled, torulose, erect to erect-ascending;
gynophore to 0.5 mm;
style slender, 1.5-3 mm.
Seeds dark brown, broadly ovate or subglobose, 1.2-1.5 x 1-1.2 mm, uniseriate, plump, wingless.
shoots, 20-50(-60) cm, angled, +- glabrous, decumbent to +- erect, branched.

Flowers ca. 5 mm diameter.

blade deeply pinnatisect, (lobes 3-6 on each side, sublinear, lanceolate, oblong, elliptic, or ovate), (2-)3.5-15(-20) cm x (7-)10-45(-60) mm, base usually not auriculate, rarely minutely auriculate, margins dentate, serrate, subentire, or (distally) pinnatisect, (lobes 1-3 on each side).
Fruiting pedicels divaricate, straight, (3-)4-10(-12) mm.

Herbs perennial, (5-)15-80(-100) cm tall, glabrous or sparsely pubescent.
lateral lobes 3-6 on each side of midvein, sublinear, lanceolate, oblong, elliptic, or ovate, margin dentate or serrate, sometimes subentire;
uppermost leaves with 1-3 lateral lobes or not lobed, often subsessile.

anthers oblong, 0.7-1 mm.

stigma subentire or slightly 2-lobed.
Seeds reddish brown, ovoid, colliculate, uniseriate or rarely subbiseriate, 0.6-0.9 x 0.4-0.5 mm.
Perennial, stoloniferous, 20-50 cm tall, suberect or procumbent with ascending branches, +- glabrous.
Flowers 4-5 mm across, yellow;

A far-creeping rhizomatous nearly glabrous perennial 45-120 cm forming large stands.

Culms laxly tufted, 50-100 cm tall, obtusely trigonous, stiff, slightly scabrous on upper part, with red-brown and bladeless sheaths at base, sheaths later splitting into reticulate fibers.
Leaves shorter than or nearly equaling culm, blades 1-2 mm wide, involute on margins, slightly plicate, stiff, with transverse septate nodes between veins, rather long sheathed.
Involucral bracts leafy, linear, nearly equaling or slightly longer than inflorescence, lower involucral bracts up to 5 mm sheathed, upper involucral bracts nearly not sheathed.
Spikes 3-5;

stigmas 3.
A glabrous tufted perennial 40-90 cm.

blades mid to dark green, flat to W-shaped, 4-13 mm wide, glabrous.

beak poorly defined, 1.2-2.2 mm, strongly bidentate, teeth straight or slightly out-curved, 0.7-1.2(-1.4) mm.
Stigmas 3.
Culms tufted, 30-70 cm tall, rather stout, trigonous, scabrous on angles of upper part.

terminal spike male, narrowly cylindric, 2-3 cm, pedunculate;

sheaths 5-20 cm, yellowish or reddish, margin of scarious side concave;

3 inner bristles obovate, subsessile, gradually narrowed to base, margin ciliate, apex emarginate and with 3 prominent veins, with 1 costa usually excurrent into a short curved awn.

floral scales deciduous, (10-)12-20(-25), laterally light reddish brown to dark red, medially greenish, laterally ribless, medially 3-5-ribbed, oblong-ovate, 1.7-2(-2.4) x 0.9-1.2 mm, apex obtuse, barely reaching next scale, apex entire, emarginate, mucro at most 0.3 mm.

styles 0.3-0.6 mm;

Herbs or subshrubs, erect, 0.5-1(-2) m tall, armed, minutely tomentose with many-celled, simple, mostly glandular hairs.

leaf blade broadly ovate, 6-13 x 6-12 cm, with prickles and coarse, many-celled, glandular simple hairs on both surfaces, these mixed with sparse, sessile, stellate hairs abaxially, base truncate to short hastate, margin 3-5-lobed or -parted;

lobes lanceolate, ca. 2.5 x 10 mm, pubescent as on calyx.

Leaves 5-12 x 2-5 cm, 2-4 times as long as broad, elliptic-ovate to elliptic-lanceolate or obovate-lanceolate, acuminate, scarcely asymmetric at apex, rounded or broadly cuneate at base, finely glandular serrate, glabrous, dark green and glossy above, paler beneath, somewhat coriaceous at maturity, viscid and fragrant when young;

female 2-5 x ca. 1 cm, more slender.

A much branched, spreading and spiny shrub, 1-3 m, suckering freely.

Leaves (1-)2-8 x 0.2-1.3 cm, linear lanceolate, subsessile, alternate, with dense silvery to reddish brown scales on both sides (extending to young shoots and flowers. ) or becoming subglabrous and dull green above.

Leaves extremely variable in shape and size, linear-lanceolate to oblong, oval, or obovate-spathulate, 1-9 (-15) x 0.2-2 (-3) cm, blunt to shortly acuminate at the apex, cuneate to attenuate at the base, glabrous or thinly pilose, especially on the lower surface of the midrib;
